website_summaries.verdict: Attractive, modern looks and ample functions make this model a good choice for avid cooks, but it doesn't prepare food as fast as microwaves that emit more powerful wattage.
pros: Offers a spacious interior and one-touch buttons for making popcorn, cooking frozen dinners, and warming beverages
Styling is contemporary, interior is large
cons: This model takes up a lot of counter space
At only 800 watts, it's under-powered compared to similarly sized microwaves

website_summaries.verdict: A solid microwave that's good for small spaces; however, it tends to take a bit longer to heat up food.
pros: Users love the number of features, ease of use, and reliability of this unit
It also gets top marks for its streamlined look, and users appreciated how its compact design fits well in small kitchens
cons: The door tends to open a bit less smoothly than some other models, and some feel it takes longer to heat up food than some others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, sleek, quiet, and the right depth to fit on an upper cabinet shelf
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a 12 year old model of this microwave. The improvements are notable: prettier (more stainless, less black, softer looking sonehow) and quieter in operation. Fewer specific touch pad control buttons, most of which I never used anyway. As far as I could research, it is still the only available lesser-depth microwave (12-ish inches deep), which is what I want on the open shelf in my cabinets. I might not have had an alternative, but I'm very glad to have this one.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Quality/Door Not Closing Always, Have to retry
customer_reviews.text: What I liked about this microwave is the size - I was looking for a smaller depth microwave due to our cabinet size/limitation. This one did fit and it seems to be working okay. Unfortunately, after less than a couple months, the door is not closing properly and you have to do it a couple times. It can still be used (to microwave), though one would think and hope such an issue should not occur after a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Ritzu

customer_reviews.title: a downturn for the GE product replacement
customer_reviews.text: as others have said, the door is cheaper/lighter now and smudges show easily. The timer alarm beeps only once and too quietly...Ive forgotten stuff on the stove already bec of its lack of help. Seems to microwave alright althou perhaps with a bit less power. Smaller rotational turn "table" on it too. Definitely liked my previous GE better (except for the peeling ceiling) which is no longer made and this is the comparable replacement. It didn't fit in the same "built in" spot...we add to file down the top of the shelve to be able to open the door of the microwave even thou the dimensions seemed similar. I don't have high hopes for this lasting long.
customer_reviews.author: camk

customer_reviews.title: Lower quality than model this replaces
customer_reviews.text: Only microwave manufactured with the correct dimensions to replace previous m/w. That fits into upper kithdn cabinet. Overpriced for size and less power than previous model. Also motor that for turntable very noisy and rattles. But no other option availabie for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Twice.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace my current GE microwave. I want to share a photo of the GE Spacemaker I am replacing so you can see that peeling paint on the interior of GE microwaves is a real problem. I didn’t notice it right away, so there is no telling how much paint I consumed in my food. Many other reviewers have had the same problem with their GE microwaves. Unfortunately, GE makes the only microwave that fits perfectly into a 24” cabinet opening so I was prepared to give it another shot. But, unfortunately, this unit came with a scratch on it, so back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Fits on a twelve inch shelf!! Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This microwave is amazing! It's gorgeous and looks beautiful on my 12 inch shelf! I think this is one of the very few microwaves that fit on a 12 inch shelf which is the reason why I bought it. It won't fit a full sized dinner plate but will fit a salad plate, which is fine. If you need it to fit under a small shelf, get this one! If you don't have to worry about space, you might want a bigger one. It's very sturdy and it's super quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: 3 defective units thus far.
customer_reviews.text: It was the replacement for a defective one I purchased 3 weeks ago. The door on this unit was loose and did not sit balanced on a flat surface. Cooking was uneven, sometimes food was hot, sometimes not so hot. Returned it to purchase a 3rd one which I’m also about to return. I have the feeling they received the defective unit and reshipped It back to me. I’m stuck with this GE model because of space restriction. I’m a very frustrated buyer right now.
customer_reviews.author: CarlyQ57

customer_reviews.title: 3rd time is a charm?
customer_reviews.text: Had one in the condo I bought, and it quit about a month after I bought the place. Bought a second one here on amazon... and it quit too, about a week after the 90 day warranty expired... used 2-4 times a week. Amazon saved the day and still honored the warranty (HUGE THANK YOU!!!) On the replacement unit now and it’s still kicking after about a year. If this one goes... I WILL NOT buy another GE.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: I had the same model but 7+ years old and it took a dump. I was super limited to what we could get due to the built in, budget and I dont want to reconfigure my cabinets. I had a trim plate on my old one that looked like I could reuse but nope. So figure on spending another 100 on the trim. The microwave works fine, only 800watts and I'm not fond of it but it's just a convenience and only used a few times a week so it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER Muskie

customer_reviews.title: Replacing Spacemaker II JEM31SF01 under cabinet mout with this unit
customer_reviews.text: It would be helpful to see the top of the microwave if you are using it as a under cabinet installation. (See attached photo) to verify its application as a under cabinet model. You can see the pop out buttons for the mounting holes. The hole are the same on the left side of the unit as the Spacemaker II, but in a different location on the right side. GE's online Website has a template for the holes, but scaling it is difficult, Too bad GE decided to save what? Three cents by not including a mounting template. It would have save a LOT of time and frustration!
customer_reviews.author: The Collector

customer_reviews.title: It looks great with the trim kit around it
customer_reviews.text: This is the only microwave on the market at a reasonable price for the opening we needed. It looks great with the trim kit around it, like a built in. The power at only 800watts is half of what I'm used to, but I don't really cook in it just reheat things so that is fine. Just know it will take longer if you are used to a higher wattage microwave! Also, a regular size plate will fit in it, so that's good.
customer_reviews.author: Ara

customer_reviews.title: Feel cheap and not well designed
customer_reviews.text: For the application, this might be the only GE that fits so there is not many choices. This microwave is unnecessarily small and gets dirty with finger prints easily. Add to that it doesn’t clean well for some reason. Regular stainless steel cleaners don’t seem to work. And it’s overpriced. What was GE thinking?
customer_reviews.author: Spenav

customer_reviews.title: I bought this unit for its dimensions.  It replaces the same model which only lasted 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: This unit has all of the functions I require. Since it is only 800 Watts, you may need to extend recommended cooking times a bit. It is very versatile (for example, the (turntable may be disabled), and fits my space on a 12 inch shelf perfectly, however I was disappointed that my last one only lasted 5 years, and it would have cost more in repairs (by a certified GE repairman) than acquiring a new one. Although I never before have purchased extended warranties on an appliance, I did purchase the Assurant policy that Amazon offered. It must be purchased on the same day as the appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this GE microwave please- GE products are not what they used to be - sad
customer_reviews.text: My old microwave broke; I called GE and was told this is the newer model. I purchased it as instructed. Upon receiving it I realized the microwave was not a quality one even though it is the most expensive of all small build in units. It does not heat up well; it is all plastic and feels like a toy. This microwave is awful and not what GE used to be. I do not recommend it and if you need any more reasons please contact me. I bought a different one from Amazon and I am very happy with the new choice!!
customer_reviews.author: ORCPA-MB

customer_reviews.title: Slim & Trim
customer_reviews.text: Long & narrow, this fits perfectly in a small kitchen. We bought it to replace the identical model we had for many many years, hung with a bracket under the cupboards. (BTW - The old one still works fine, but is white and we wanted stainless/black). The only changes we notice are the round tray that rotates (rather than stay-in-place rectangular glass tray), and a number of new buttons for food heating options. Looks great, and works great but, just to be clear, this won't accommodate large dinner plates or such.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Teacher

customer_reviews.title: This latest one doesn't feel like it's made as well as the last one
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd GE spacesaver microwave we've bought. The quality seems to be going down. The paint on the inside of the unit starts to peal away probably ending up in our food. We've bought this third one because our cabinets are built around it. This latest one doesn't feel like it's made as well as the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, but they have you over a barrel
customer_reviews.text: This microwave is fine, however it is Basically $150 too expensive compared to other similar models, only because it is literally THE ONLY one this size that is 13" deep. Which is still 1/2 deeper than the model it replaced....a HUGE annoyance because it does not really fit into the cabinet I had constructed for its predecessor. That said, you are stuck buying it because it is NEARLY the size you want. UGH.
customer_reviews.author: AJWSF

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit With GE Trim Kit
customer_reviews.text: Installed with the recommended GE trim kit and think it looks great. This unit is also very quiet and heats well and even. We looked for a unit with a matching trim kit FOREVER!!!! Has to replace original. So difficult to find with these built-ins. But this fit our space very well. Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cooling

customer_reviews.title: That's idiotic. It's quieter than the old one
customer_reviews.text: It's a replacement for the older Profile series microwave, but it requires about 1/4 inch more clearance in cabinet than the old one. That's idiotic. It's quieter than the old one, which is nice, but sometimes it just doesn't seem to heat stuff. Not sure why. It may have to go back.
customer_reviews.author: N. Franke

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed the holes for mounting are located in different spots
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the same model I purchased about 6 years ago. I was very disappointed the holes for mounting are located in different spots, so that caused me extra work. Additionally, it's not quite the same size, so with a perfect fitting builtin that causes yet more problems..... Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Jack B

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long
customer_reviews.text: This item along with the trim kit were purchased because they fit into a built in microwave space in my cabinets. To the day after the warranty expired, the rotating turntable stopped working. This is a very expensive microwave for its size but the quality is poor.
customer_reviews.author: LBZ mom

customer_reviews.title: looks like brand new!
customer_reviews.text: Received my good as new microwave oven...it looks like brand new, really surprised, packaging was great and well done, works fine, hope it will continue to work well. This was to replace like for like, same model so I did not have to drill new holes, fit right in place! The price was great, more than 100 dollar savings from brand new and it really looks brand new. I was reluctant to buy this used but am very happy. did not give 5 stars because missing the glass turntable, I did contact customer service on that to see if they could send me one but even so very happy and would buy from good as new again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality but great smudges, too!
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a well functioning microwave but the smudges that continue to need wiping is not ideal. I love how it functions, it's fairly quiet and it's new so I think for now that it works great. The more we use, the more I will know. I would like to find something that will work for cleaning..for now I use a dry cloth. It's a pain having to clean it constantly. I'm so glad we did not install above the oven, double ovens would not allow for this.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle G. Beal

customer_reviews.title: Good, but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because it was the only one on the market which had the dimensions to fit under my cabinet -- it replaced the older model, which was installed in my unit years ago (probably 2003), but had now begun to peel. It functions the same way, so I cannot complain, but its 800 watts is no more powerful than my old 800-watt version of this appliance. Since so many 1000 watt microwaves are considerably cheaper, I think that this microwave is over-priced. Caveat: I have not tested special features, such as sensor, or defrost -- I just set the number of minutes and then test for doneness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Swap-in replacement for prior GE microwave
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it took less than 30 minutes to unpack and swap in the new microwave since the mounting holes and threads were identical to the GE microwave I was taking out. Reassuring that 20 years later I can still buy a swap-in replacement for a space saving microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Good

customer_reviews.title: There are NO lights on the keypad which makes it a pain to use at night or in low light.
customer_reviews.text: There are NO lights on the keypad!! Never thought to check in the description about THAT! It's a pain to use in any low light and impossible at night. I knew the wattage was low, but I couldn't find another one to fit my space. I regret not seeking a different alternative.
customer_reviews.author: patmatt56

customer_reviews.title: UNHAPPY CUSTOMER
customer_reviews.text: This is JUNK, After a month or so, the turntable doesnt work properly, no recourse. Turntable makes a loud growling sound, magnetron heavy vibration. Unit purchased in February. We should be able to get a replacement. Hope someone will help!!
customer_reviews.author: glenda diane johnston

customer_reviews.title: Not enough power!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Microwave to replace the existing one that was the same make and model before and we could not find anything else to fit the space. The microwave is a great space saver , but does not have enough power because of the low wattage. So, unless you are in a situation similar to ours, we would not recommend it. Moreover, it is very expensive for the purpose it serves, if any.
customer_reviews.author: KoulA

customer_reviews.title: do not buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This microsoft oven has the most stupidly designed metrics I have ever seen. It is wide, but lacks depth. So, although very wide inside, it can only host a tiny rotary plate, which means the extra width is totally wasted. Also. because it lacks depth, a slight press on the opened door downward would tilt the whole device, which renders it unstable on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit , looks great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a microwave to be built in Under an existing cabinet . This microwave was the perfect solution because it was not as deep as most. It looks and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Callie

customer_reviews.title: GE should include the install template
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, very quiet. Looks great. But the unit does not have the template or hardware to attach it under the counter. It took some digging around but I found the hardware for about 12$. But the template was a bit more difficult to sort out. Once I found it the next problem was not being able to print it on a regular printer in full size, in the end I figured it out and made my own template.
customer_reviews.author: J Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this GE Profile microwave oven.
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it very much. It is much quieter than my previous microwave oven. It was purchased for installation under a cabinet in a spot where few microwave ovens could fit. I would not recommend for purchase as a counter-top appliance because the top is not meant to be visible (it is not finished in stainless steel).
customer_reviews.author: Clouds Wind Mist

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t know they made it out of tin foil
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to upgrade my cheap microwave to match upgrade kitchen appliances. Well I am not kidding when I say my $60 one is so much better quality. This one is so flimsy like made out of tin. Fingerprints galore. Low power so cooking takes longer. I am very disappointed in GE Profile. It used to be a good product
customer_reviews.author: elyce

customer_reviews.title: Good Microwave
customer_reviews.text: It's mountable but doesn't come with the mount. I ended up just putting it on the counter which was not what I wanted but hey, it's a microwave.
customer_reviews.author: LILMAMAMLINDE

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, but ...
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this microwave is underpowered & over priced. No problem heating liquids, but you'll have to compute additional cooking time to thoroughly heat frozen meals, etc. Also, the buttons are surprisingly difficult to depress & the interior is too small for anything larger than a salad plate. But ... this was the only decent looking stainless steel unit that would fit in my space & it does look nice & sleek in my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper51

customer_reviews.title: 12 months later... it's dead.
customer_reviews.text: This microwave is 3 times the cost of a regular microwave and after 12 months of use ours just died. We don't use it more that once or twice a day. It's usually to reheat a drink or make some popcorn. Hard to recommend this to anyone when compared to my old white countertop microwave from college lasted 8+ years, at half the cost!
customer_reviews.author: J. Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Defective & they know it
customer_reviews.text: turntable doesn't work. just bought a 2nd one & have same issue
customer_reviews.author: lloyder

customer_reviews.title: This is lower wattage than previous  model
customer_reviews.text: As is the case with so many others, this product was ordered simply because it's the only one that would fit the dimensions of my space after having had the previous GE spacemaker II microwave. It is attractive, and fits well. BUT, the wattage is much lower than the last model, and it takes a lot longer to heat things up. Light is dimmer, and it is quieter too - almost seems like it isn't working. this model is 800 watts - I believe previous model was 1.2 kilowatts - 1-1/2 times more powerful. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It is okay. You have to push really hard ...
customer_reviews.text: It is okay. You have to push really hard on the buttons to get it to work, it was more difficult to install than expected. I will not order large appliances on-line again. I need to see them in the stores to make sure they work properly. It arrived on time, no fault with that. Thanks, Sue MacKenzie
customer_reviews.author: Sue D. Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: like pizza or a "plate of food"
customer_reviews.text: The sensor does not seem to work too well since it always heats foods up way too much! The older model allowed you to set the amount of food you are reheating, this one, just lets you set the kind of food, like pizza or a "plate of food"... We liked the older model so we could choose how much food we are reheating or cooking.
customer_reviews.author: M.H.

customer_reviews.title: Broke right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a GE spacesaver that worked really well for years. Figured it was basically the same model and even though it was $300, our older model was great. Well, right out of the box, the door would not open. Also the unit itself wobbled on a flat surface so was clearly warped or poorly designed. Thank goodness Amazon is so good about returns. GE, you should be ashamed of your poor quality control!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Better order a mounting kit to go with it
customer_reviews.text: The bolts to screw into the microwave are next to impossible to find. Evidently its a huge secret as to "M5 0.8mm" You may as well look for the Davinci code if you want to find them in a store. Thanks GE- good machine- looks great under the cabinet, but a definite rip off for the mounting kit! Don't even get me started about the lack of instructions!
customer_reviews.author: Georgia L. LaMar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Well if you're like us and have the GE Space Saver built in microwave, then you don't have too many options other than buying another. Other than paying $299 for a $120 microwave, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ray C

customer_reviews.title: Had to hammer out some shelves to gain the extra space while the cord sticking straight out the back forces it to protrude more
customer_reviews.text: New model was a little bigger than the GE space saver I was replacing, 1/4 inch here and there - nightmare to install. Had to hammer out some shelves to gain the extra space while the cord sticking straight out the back forces it to protrude more than I would like. Timer doesn't seem to work but after the hassle of installing I'm not gonna send it back. Hope I don't live to regret that decision. Spent the extra $200 for the space save model and ignored bad reviews regarding paint peeling, etc. 'cause I didn't want to take up scant counter space. Again, hope I don't come to regret this...
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Poxon

customer_reviews.title: Sent similar microwave with different model number
customer_reviews.text: We just pulled this microwave out of the box and were about to install it. Problem is the trim kit doesn’t fit. It took a while for us to realize that the seller actually sent us the wrong microwave. It looks like the one we ordered but the dimensions are not the same. As shown in the picture above it’s a different model number entirely. Beware the bait and switch. There’s not really a problem unless you want to use the trim kit. Because the one they sent us has huge gaps around the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inferior quality compared to the GE Profile microwave I originally had
customer_reviews.text: I use a microwave a lot and I ordered this when my previous one died. It is very much an inferior quality - the panel is hard to see and the buttons are hard to push are the biggest complaints,
customer_reviews.author: Lannie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Our older model spacesaver finally gave up the ghost. We liked it's operation but more critically a new model had to fit in the exact same tight space. This works perfectly on both scores. A++
customer_reviews.author: John Westman

customer_reviews.title: The Walmart $35 microwave we used while waiting for this thing worked way better. I can't believe for this much money the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits the space I need which is the only reason I purchased. No other options fit in my kitchen. Total piece of GE junk. Takes over a minute to heat a bottle, buttons are junk and you need to push hard for buttons to work. The door open button is junk and feels cheap. The Walmart $35 microwave we used while waiting for this thing worked way better. I can't believe for this much money the buttons don't light up.... This is my second one I highly advise do not buy GE. Last one lost all of the interior paint before motor failed.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Large enough to fit a caserole dish and looks great. I don't like pushing an extra button to ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the only, if not the only, microwaves that fit a 12.5" deep upper cabinet. Large enough to fit a caserole dish and looks great. I don't like pushing an extra button to start the microwave though. Why can the Microwave manufacturers realize that 90% of the time you just want to push 45 then start instead of searching for "Cook Time" then 45 then start. The default should be that consumer wan't "Cook Time" unless they say otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Arrison IV

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a compact, under cabinet installation.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement of a similar model. We were pleased enough to stick with the same brand and configuration. I like the new one better principally because it is much quieter. The under cabinet installation was funky at best. 4 mounting screws aligned as a trapazoid without a mounting template.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Under cabinet microwave
customer_reviews.text: Microwave works as advertised. Purchased as a replacement for a similar, older model, under cabinet microwave (Previous micro lasted 13 years). We purchased this model because it can hang from bottom of upper cabinets. This model is slightly deeper and the plug is a different shape from previous model. The plug no longer fits in the outlet we had installed behind the microwave. The cord is now visible. Not a huge deal, but disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: mdandre

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted two years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microwave to match the remainder of my GE appliances in the kitchen. This size was the only one that would fit in the cabinet space. Well just over two years old and it no longer works. Started getting power failure errors despite power not going off. Now I get flashing 8888. I can’t reset this. Was quoted over $200 to fix. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Number_27

customer_reviews.title: It is beautiful, works great
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely thrilled with the purchase! It is beautiful, works great, and is the only microwave we could find that wasn't too deep. This model is the exact depth of upper cabinets. It gives the appearance of a built in, as a result. It really is a must have, if you are trying to put it under upper cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: AMDG

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY, third one of these i have owned.  this one broke 14 months after buying
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought two of these microwaves as a replacement for one that came in a custom cutout in my kitchen. This is the only microwave that will fit that space, which is only reason I bought a third one. Hiring a carpenter now to change cabinetry because I am tired of buying GE Microwaves that breakdown. And don't expect anyone from GE Appliance customer services to pick up the phone. Just Voicemail maze and hours on hold.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dooher

customer_reviews.title: It is more powerful than my last version.
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous version of this microwave that had more power. Maybe it was just old but this new one heats things up way way faster than the 1,200 watt version I had. I am not a fan of the turn table so I pulled the glass tray out of the bottom of the old one and put it in this and turn the turn table function off. It is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Peterman

customer_reviews.title: Will not last
customer_reviews.text: I have tried two of these microwaves and both lasted around a year. WAY too expensive for such a short life. I am disappointed in myself for ordering a second one after the first quit working but it is hard to find alternatives for this width and depth.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: short life bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product, this is the second unit that I bought and they both stopped working after two years.. I’m somewhat stuck with this size of Microwave because I custom built my kitchen furniture... Don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.author: O. Cunliffe

customer_reviews.title: Great compact microwave
customer_reviews.text: We needed a very narrow microwave for our cabinet that’s only 15” deep. Apparently they are hard to find, so we got this one. It’s a great microwave, works well and looks really nice with the trim kit. Little pricey for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact unit
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for my space. The GE trim kit (sold separately) that is compatible with it is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Scalia

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was a better product. The cost was almost the same for ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. GE quit making the original I put in from 2008. I wish I would have bought the part to repair the old one. I thought it was a better product. The cost was almost the same for the board.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Too Big outside smaller inside
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to replace our JEM31SF01 GE Profile Spacemaker II Sensor It was the one GE claimed fit in the same space. However the PEM31SF1SS is an inch taller and will require you modify the cabinet to make it fit. It is much cheaper look and much smaller inside and less power. But all we could find as replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed to fill the built in space left by my ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed to fill the built in space left by my old GE Profile. It fit w/just a few cuts done by my husband. If you’re in the same predicament that I was in (and I searched everywhere) then this is the microwave for you. Arrived promptly & no hassles.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Goughler

customer_reviews.title: If you need to replace a 10 year old GE microwave, you need this one
customer_reviews.text: Price vs Quality is very disappointing. But I had to buy this model to replace my 10 year old one. You also need a new mounting unit to fit in, which is also EXTRA $$$. I won't buy GE if I had a choice.
customer_reviews.author: Taesun Byun

customer_reviews.title: 'Worked' for a few weeks...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to order this microwave to fit an existing opening in our cabinets. It worked fine for a few weeks, and now it never shuts off. If you plug it back it, it immediately starts running again. POS.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Baker

customer_reviews.title: Unique size fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the only microwave of its size. Works great, but not the most powerful microwave you'll ever own
customer_reviews.author: William W

customer_reviews.title: the right size and the right usage for today’s required microwave cooking
customer_reviews.text: I am a kitchen and bath designer and use this microwave as often as possible in my projects
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Locked in to size, disposable microwave line.
customer_reviews.text: This is our 5th GE Profile Microwave in the past 14 years, locked in by cabinet design. The first ones either stopped running or lost their control panel, the last one we kept way too long as we ignored paint flaked off throughout it, falling on food and likely unsafe. Wheels always fall off turning ring, etc. I keep hoping the designs improve. This one arrived, and works fine as they do in the beginning. Oddly, its taller than the previous 3, so I had to rip out the framing around it to fit. Same model number, new taller size, so be warned in case you too have a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: MSB 90266

customer_reviews.title: Similar to previous models
customer_reviews.text: My third GE Spacesaver in 30 years. Excellent operation. Attaches under cabinet but holes did not line up where previous two attached. Still waiting to get it installed. Works fine as a countertop.
customer_reviews.author: Widowed Emptynester

customer_reviews.title: Not GE profile...
customer_reviews.text: This is not a GE Profile microwave, it’s a GE microwave. It does not match my GE Profile double ovens, in fact the stainless finish is plastic—no metal on front facing of microwave or trim kit. Not happy, as the color of the time does not match the color of the time on my ovens either. I’m trying my best to buy American and this was such an underwhelming purchase. GE, you can do better!
customer_reviews.author: Holly O

customer_reviews.title: Only microwave that fits into the narrow space of our cabinets
customer_reviews.text: Only microwave that fits into the narrow space of our cabinets
customer_reviews.author: Harvg

customer_reviews.title: Not As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Product is advertised as a GE Profile Microwave, which it is not. It is a standard GE Microwave. Also it is advertised as being 12-1/8" height, which it is not. The unit is 11-1/4" high: a full inch too short for the space allocated for it.
customer_reviews.author: staylor

customer_reviews.title: GE Microwave
customer_reviews.text: Fit our cabinet perfect. It is almost silent while it’s running. Very nice microwave!
customer_reviews.author: nicnlo56

customer_reviews.title: Compact Mircowave
customer_reviews.text: Very nice small microwave - Fits nicely in our built in microwave cabinet. Food takes a little longer compared to over more powerful microwaves but that's expected with WATT size. Matches LG studio stainless finish - Looks high end.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Hesse

customer_reviews.title: I like the previous model better
customer_reviews.text: The turning wheel is smaller than in the previous model.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great small microwave
customer_reviews.text: We looked for weeks for a new microwave for our new kitchen that would fit on our built in space. We came home with 2 microwaves that we took back....too small, too cheap looking. Then we found this one on line. Love it and the surround to give it a built in look.
customer_reviews.author: VLW

customer_reviews.title: PLATE NOT SUPPORTED AND FALLS OFF
customer_reviews.text: We just installed the microwave in the new kitchen and the turntable is wobbly. The plate is held only by a center support socket with no rollers that support the plate.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: So far it works fine. I will it had 1000 or 1200 power ...
customer_reviews.text: I got it because it fits the space--GE is the only one who makes a wide microwave that is short enough. So far it works fine. I will it had 1000 or 1200 power instead of just 800,
customer_reviews.author: EditorMotz

customer_reviews.title: Good Micro in Size Range
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to find this size to fit in the space we have from our older built in. A kit is also available if your cabinet space is a bit too wide.Microwave does a terrific job.We mainly use it to steam veggies. Turntable easy to clean in dishwasher. If you want to cook in volume this is not for you but for smaller portions or recipes this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: I Shop 2

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Microwave that fits!
customer_reviews.text: It took me four months of searching for a microwave that would it the opening in my built-in cabinets. This microwave fits almost perfectly and functions great!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Works great -- perfect fit to replace its 15 year-old predecessor
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 15 year-old version of this microwave oven and it's a good thing it's a high quality unit because it's the only one on the planet that perfectly fit the space the old one filled. If you are installing it as a "built-in" like I did, then make sure you also buy the GE JX827SFSS 27" Stainless Steel Deluxe Microwave Trim Kit.
customer_reviews.author: AbeK

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is the straightforward microwave oven we need for warming leftovers and making popcorn. Sturdy, easy to clean and fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Zapes

customer_reviews.title: Electrical short within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 6 months. Then had electrical short. Called company for support and since I bought it before our kitchen renovation was complete we were “out of our window.” When I explained the problem GE support had nothing to offer. So $350 later for about 6 months worth of use
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a wall cabinet. High quality.
customer_reviews.text: Its very hard to find a microwave that fits a wall cabinet. This is an excellent model, very quiet, heats food evenly. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: DMacP

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as well as my previous GE Profile ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as well as my previous GE Profile, but it is the only one with the dimensions that will fit into my cabinetry so I am stuck with it. GE said this is the replacement for the JEM31, but is is a different size and I have to buy a new trim kit...another $150.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Box

customer_reviews.title: Door opening button not great, but so far does what the other did
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a 10year old GE SS slimline. The new one is one inch taller that the old one and that proved problematic for the built in look. Door opening button not great, but so far does what the other did....so OK.
customer_reviews.author: Suereader

customer_reviews.title: but it's a good buy to replace the older GE microwave
customer_reviews.text: The only reason we went with this model is because of the space limitation, however the product exceeded my expectations. It runs very quiet and heats food evenly. For the $/watt, it's expensive, but it's a good buy to replace the older GE microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: This model fits the bill perfect. I like the sensor and how is heats
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot about this product and considered what my needs where from a microwave. This model fits the bill perfect. I like the sensor and how is heats. It's compact size fits great under my upper kitchen cabinets and feels solid. I bought the generic mounting installation kit and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: B Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Compact size fits under our cabinet
customer_reviews.text: This is our third Space Saver. Its the Only game in town because of its size. Fast selection of cooking times. The power cord should be molded flat at the back of the cabinet. Then the unit would fit flush against the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Under cabinet mount !
customer_reviews.text: It’s a microwave, bought it because u can mount this one under a cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: ian cory

customer_reviews.title: Normal Microwave but slightly larger than the last model
customer_reviews.text: Decent microwave but the company made it just 1/2" larger than the last model, so if you have a fitted space for it, this could be an issue. Measure carefully!
customer_reviews.author: Food 🥦Fit Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not sp great
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the quality of this product considering the price. Motor is noisy, door and latch bang shut and panel is hard to read. The only reason to buy this is because you need the size to fit in to a 12 1/2 inch shelf as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only time will tell
customer_reviews.text: nice low profile design. I really wish products were made to last long than 3-5 yrs. especially at this price point!
customer_reviews.author: Selena Malott

customer_reviews.title: best choice for shallow shelved microwave
customer_reviews.text: replaced an old GE profile. Doesn't heat fast, but expected with the lower wattage. Hard to find a shallow depth microwave. This is the way to go if you messed up your kitchen design and forgot to put the deep shelf in for the microwave, as long as you have the width for it.
customer_reviews.author: cwdrz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for shallow cabinet
customer_reviews.text: This is the only microwave we could get to fit our shallow cabinet (a little less than 12 inches deep). It’s not huge Or super strong so it’s overpriced for what you get. Overall, it does its job and it looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Undermount!
customer_reviews.text: Only Undermount microwave oven I’ve ever found. Second one I’ve bought. First one lasted 13 years. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: iamom

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a step down from the former model. Seems cheap and tinny, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lupetti

customer_reviews.title: Space saver
customer_reviews.text: Good micro and space saver. Have to get used to the lower power compared with my previous but nothing wrong with that.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great as a built-in replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a built-in GE Spacesaver microwave. Cabinet depth & width limited my choices but this one works great, and with the stainless steel trim kit it looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Callaghan

customer_reviews.title: Love my new stainless microwave
customer_reviews.text: Love my new stainless microwave! Arrived quickly and the price was very good. It fits nicely in my small space built for a space saver microwave which is almost impossible to find these days. I'm happy!!
customer_reviews.author: PDaniel

customer_reviews.title: need to get acclimated to power setting compared to old large unit
customer_reviews.text: 30 sec feature is great. need to get acclimated to power settings.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rozsa

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars510 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
